remarks: This lemma proves that the function ` g ` (as defined in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 91, at the end of page 91) belongs to the subalgebra.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem17.1 $e |- F/ t ph $.
stoweidlem17.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem17.3 $e |- ( ph -> X : ( 0 ... N ) --> A ) $.
stoweidlem17.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) + ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem17.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem17.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR ) -> ( t e. T |-> x ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem17.7 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR ) $.
stoweidlem17.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem17 $p |- ( ph -> ( t e. T |-> sum_ i e. ( 0 ... N ) ( E x. ( ( X ` i ) ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
$d A f g $.
$d A x $.
$d E f g i t $.
$d E i t $.
$d E t x $.
$d N i t $.
$d T f g i t $.
$d T i t $.
$d T t x $.
$d X f g i t $.
$d X i t $.
$d f g i ph $.
$d ph x $.
